content: middle round is a pivot round which should be pop colors different from your others when chart is finished work a round or two all in one color bind off 2 chart notes the stitches marked in light green are the steek stitches they are to be worked in the same colors as your fabric stitches the round begins in the middle of a steek the first and third steeks use vertical lines the steek in the center of the chart is called a salt and pepper pattern if using multiple colors change at the beginning of the round in the middle of the steek if you are using colored markers you may want to color code the marker lines to match your markers this will help you keep track of your place on the chart work the chart from right to left one time slipping markers between the green and white stitches repeat the chart one more time to finish the round both colors are used in each round remember to stretch your stitches on your right-hand needle when changing from one color to the other in the round this will help prevent puckering by making floats long enough across the wrong side of the work key 3 preparing the steeks for cutting you have four steeks to use for practice each steek is 9 stitches which is what is recommended for fairisle knitting two are columns of alternating colors the other two are salt and pepper 1 you can use different techniques for securing the steeks in each of the steek sections 2 locate the center stitch of your steek 3 secure the first steek using whatever method you choose 4 secure another steek using a different method etc refer to the methods for preparing and cutting steeks listed on ravelry in knitting in the loft simply stranded ~~~ 2025 loft summer edit challenge & kal page 1 post #4 ravelry knitting in the loft discussion topic - simply stranded ~~~ 2025 loft summer challenge & kal 4
